title: Boundary Conditions and Responsible Application
objective: Identify proper limits for applying a theological claim to contemporary contexts

segments.audio_script: This is lesson fourteen. We examine boundary conditions for application.
No passage required. Consider differences between ancient context and today.
Responsible application recognizes cultural, temporal, and canonical distances. Not all instructions transfer uniformly across contexts.
List relevant differences and justify which aspects of a claim transfer and which do not. Use analogical reasoning carefully.
Key skill: responsible hermeneuticsâ€”apply with documented reasoning and humility.
What must you document when applying a claim to modern contexts?
This completes lesson fourteen. Next lesson treats coherence with broader theological witness.

vocabulary.definition: Factors that limit or qualify the appropriate application of a theological claim

study_notes: Application requires careful analogical work; record assumptions and limits for review.
